Full stack refers to the entire spectrum of software development covering both the front-end (user interface) and the back-end (server, database, and application infrastructure). A full-stack developer is proficient in creating and managing the user-facing parts of an application, the underlying logic and operations, databases, and sometimes even server and deployment architecture. In essence, they're capable of building a software application from start to finish.
